DataElementConcept.preferredName: Infection Disease Marker Laboratory Procedure Source
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003_Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Where something is available or from where it originates.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003:Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.

Where something is available or from where it originates.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2693219, Biologic:typeCode

ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedObservationResult > PerformedObservation > Subject [mother] > BiologicEntity[1] > AssociatedBiologcEntity.typeCode WHERE AssociatedBiologicEntity.typeCode = "mother" AND AssociatedBiologicEntity > BiologicEntity[2] > Subject [donor] > PerformedSubstanceExtraction > Biologic.typeCode = "cord blood"
